head.title: A City in Ruins: Americans Open Their Hearts

hedline.hl1: A City in Ruins: Americans Open Their Hearts

block.p: My heart goes out to those affected by Hurricane Katrina. The devastation caused by this hurricane, however, should be a wake-up call that perhaps stronger regulations should be enforced in the future about where structures can be built and how strongly built they should be.

My heart goes out to those affected by Hurricane Katrina. The devastation caused by this hurricane, however, should be a wake-up call that perhaps stronger regulations should be enforced in the future about where structures can be built and how strongly built they should be.
The devastation could just as well have hit any coastal city in the United States, yet we persist in building homes and buildings on and near the water.
One can only imagine the destruction in future years as the land continues to subside in some areas and water levels rise around the world as a result, in part, of global warming.
Claude M. Gruener Austin, Tex., Aug. 31, 2005
